CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 13;Violation of P1-1;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary and non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the village of GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the ORG ( hereafter “ the ORG ” ) awarded the applicant a total of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL against the PERSON Elektroispolnitelnyh Mekhanizmov Company ( hereafter “ the Company ” ) in salary arrears . Both judgments became final and were sent to the GPE ORG ( hereafter “ the Bailiffs ” ) for compulsory enforcement .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s complaint about the Bailiffs’ alleged inactivity . The court pointed out that the judgments given in the applicant ’s favour could not be executed in due time and in full on account of the debtor ’s lack of funds , the moratorium on the forced sale of the property of ORG - owned enterprises and a lien placed on the company ’s assets to secure the payment of taxes . On DATE the ORG of Appeal quashed this decision and remitted the case for fresh consideration . On DATE the proceedings were discontinued on the applicant ’s request .

CARDINAL . On DATE the judgment of DATE was enforced in full . On DATE the sum awarded to the applicant by the judgment of CARDINAL DATE was transferred to his account . However , the amount of ORG was deducted by the bank as a processing fee .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law may be found in the judgment of CARDINAL DATE in the case of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE ) .
